cz.cuni.mff.d3s.spl.formula

Interface Formula

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Comparison, ComparisonWithConst, LogicAnd, LogicConst, LogicImply, LogicOr

    public interface Formula
    SPL formula. It is up to implementing classes to construct the actual formula and provide the implementation how to evaluate it. The expected usage is following: user creates the formula, using aliases for the random variables. She then binds the aliases to actual random variables. Before evaluating, it is necessary to set the mathematical apparatus used for evaluating. The apparatus can be used to determine relation between two random variables (greater/smaller, etc.). The evaluate then returns result of the evaluation at the time of calling the function.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bind(String variable, DataSource data)
      Bind given variable alias to a concrete data source.
      Result evaluate(double significanceLevel)
      Evaluate the formula.
      Set<String> getVariables()
      Get set of variables, which needs to be bound before evaluation.
      void setInterpretation(Interpretation interpretation)
      Set how to evaluate statistical tests and other mathematical operations.

    • Method Detail

      • setInterpretation

        void setInterpretation(Interpretation interpretation)
        Set how to evaluate statistical tests and other mathematical operations.
        Parameters:
        interpretation - The mathematical interpretation to use.

      • bind

        void bind(String variable,
          DataSource data)
        Bind given variable alias to a concrete data source. This method must be called for all variables in the formula prior formula evaluation.
        Parameters:
        variable - Variable name as used in the formula.
        data - Actual data source to use (must not be null).

      • evaluate

        Result evaluate(double significanceLevel)
        Evaluate the formula.
        Parameters:
        significanceLevel - Requested significance level of the result.
        Returns:
        Whether the formula evaluates to true.

      • getVariables

        Set<String> getVariables()
        Get set of variables, which needs to be bound before evaluation.
        Returns:
        Set of variables inside formula.
